title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.10 Part 2 | 15-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This means the Lord possesses transcendental qualities and therefore can attract everyone, including liberated souls.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with prayers and an introduction to the topic: the Atmarama verse (SB 1.7.10) and why even liberated souls are attracted to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So, here Suta Goswami is justifying that even liberated souls are attracted to Krishna because of his wonderful qualities.
segments.summary: Suta Goswami justifies why even liberated souls are attracted to Krishna due to his unlimited good qualities, as explained by Lord Chaitanya to Sanatana Goswami.

segments.key_quote: Krishna offers himself to his devotees because devotees don't accept anything from Krishna for the service they render to him.
segments.summary: The discussion focuses on Krishna's transcendental qualities, his unlimited nature, and his magnanimity in offering himself to his devotees because they don't seek anything in return.

segments.key_quote: When the breeze carrying the aroma of Tursi leaves and saffron from the lotus feet of the lotus eyed personality of Godhead entered through the nostrils into the hearts of those sages, the Kumaras, they experienced a change in both body and mind.
segments.summary: Krishna's qualities attract devotees through beauty, mellows, and fragrance, exemplified by the Kumaras being attracted to Krishna by the aroma of Tulsi leaves offered to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: They do not have any attraction for anything material in this world.
segments.summary: The story of the Kumaras entering Vaikuntha, being stopped by Jaya and Vijaya, and subsequently cursing them is narrated.

segments.key_quote: When they offered obeisances to the Lord's lotus feet the aroma of the Tursi leaves mixed with chandan entered their nostrils and they experienced a never before had they had an experience.
segments.summary: Lord Narayana pacifies the Kumaras, and they are captivated by his beauty and the aroma of Tulsi, leading them to become devotees.

segments.key_quote: Although I was fully situated in the transcendental position in impersonal Brahman realization, I was nonetheless attracted to the pastimes of Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: The lecture explains how Shukadeva Goswami, initially situated in impersonal Brahman realization, became attracted to Krishna's pastimes and studied Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: The gopis are completely captivated by the beauty of Krishna's transcendental form.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by describing how the Gopis, the most beautiful women, are completely captivated by Krishna's beauty and have surrendered themselves to him.
